column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Skive off Church
#Text=If you do n't want to go to church , you can try to get out of it .
#Text=What you do will depend a lot on your church , your family , and yourself .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Figure out why you do n't want to go to church .
#Text=" I do n't feel like it " may be enough of a reason for you , but it might not be enough for your family .
#Text=Think about your past record .
#Text=If you normally like to go to church but you do n't care for it any more , consider talking to your family about the reason why .
#Text=If you never liked church and you want to stop going , go on to the next steps .
#Text=Be prepared for resistance .
#Text=If your family goes to church on a regular basis and expects you to go along , you will have to either explain your situation or bargain with them .
#Text=Explain to your parents how important another activity is to you if there 's something specific you want to do instead .
#Text=Tell them you will still keep going to church , but you want to skip just this once .
#Text=Try to find some other religious activities you could do , such as a youth group , if you do n't want to go to church at all .
#Text=Offer to go to one of those activities instead of attending church with your parents .
#Text=Seek their compassion .
#Text=If you 're mature enough to make your own decisions and have your own beliefs , explain your own spiritual situation to your parents and family .
#Text=Maybe you 've simply lost interest in their church , but you still share the same faith .
#Text=Or maybe your spiritual beliefs no longer align with theirs .
#Text=Either way , try to spark a serious talk with your family about your faith and explain to them why you do n't want to attend church .
#Text=Confront your parents if your own beliefs vary with their church 's beliefs .
#Text=If you do n't want to go because you feel your family 's religion is not right for you , think it over carefully and articulate the reasons .
#Text=Write down exactly how you feel , in as clear and detailed a manner as possible .
#Text=Think like you 're presenting an argument for the debate team , so do n't be impassioned and irrational about it .
#Text=Explain how you feel to your family and be prepared for some resistance since this is a big declaration to make .
#Text=This may not work , but if you are desperate enough , then say to your parents something like this " Do you want your children to be happy ? "
#Text=Chances are they will say yes .
#Text=Then say " Well , how do you think it makes ME feel to be dragged to church without any say ? "
#Text=Try to protest about it so much that it gets on their nerves and then you eventually wo n't have to go to church .
#Text=Tips
#Text=If you 've found another religion you prefer to your family 's tradition , slowly introduce them to your new faith .
#Text=Do n't start by getting a tattoo or announcing you 've been initiated into a strange Circle .
#Text=Do n't do anything that will shock or scare your family .
#Text=Start by dropping subtle hints or asking questions .
#Text=You will always have more bargaining power with your family if your homework is done , your grades are good , your appearance is respectable and your room is tidy .
#Text=If you want more leverage , get these things in order before you start asking for favors .
#Text=Your family might feel better about your spiritual welfare if you demonstrate that you are still doing " good deeds " such as volunteering and being kind to others .
#Text=You can try going to church and sitting apart from your family .
#Text=Sitting with people you like better might be more fun .
#Text=Remember that it is you are your own person and that your family can not force you to believe anything of their preference .
#Text=You could try getting a job on Sundays to get out of having to go to church .
#Text=If you have a job and it 's Sunday , tell you 're parents I have to go to work today or I 'll be late .
#Text=Warnings
#Text=Do n't try to get out of church by pretending you 're sick or injured .
#Text=At best , it will only work once or twice .
#Text=And your family might see right through it the first time anyway .
#Text=At worst , they may drag you to church so the people there can pray for your healing .

#Text=You might possibly be faced with the problem of a parent that whenever you even hint at the subject , gets very ' disappointed ' and proceeds to give you The Spanish Inquisition about your faith and other habits .
#Text=Do n't be discouraged by this .
#Text=Proceed to explain your side of the conversation in a very calm , respectful and mature manner .
#Text=Do not make any attempts to point the matter into argument zone .
#Text=If your parent beings to get fed up , testy , highly offended , etc. , back off .
#Text=Cautiously bring it up at a better date .
#Text=If your family hints at the face that bringing up the subject again will either land you a private counseling session with the minister or a month of grounding , by no means continue .
#Text=Retreat immediately at all costs .

#Text=Consider why you do n't want to go to church and be honest with yourself ( with more easygoing parents converting to atheism can be a great way to lose all commitment but parents may react badly and hit you , force you to church weekly and to confession , disown you , and possibly anoint you regularly with holy water . )
#Text=If your family freaks out and associates skipping out on church with the condemnation of hell , then you have a larger problem .
#Text=Proceed with great caution .
#Text=Do n't ever be afraid to question .
#Text=If someone tells you not to ask questions , you might be asking the wrong person or they might not know the answer .
#Text=Try going higher up .
#Text=If the highest-ranking church official you can find still refuses to answer your questions , then the church you 're talking to is not the right one for you .
#Text=Just as there is no perfect church or parent , most parents and churches want the best for those under their roof .
#Text=Your time at home will hopefully be a small fraction of your lifetime .
#Text=If you value a good future relationship with your parents , consider not rocking the boat while in their house .
#Text=After all , it is just part of one day a week .
